lexUnit.name: lock.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: enclose someone or something by locking a door

sentence.text: They 'd locked him in a dirty little hole with a bed you would n't put a dog under .
They made the girl go back to Baskerville Hall with them , and locked her in a room upstairs .
He locked himself in his private room and by 10.20 a.m. he had made two phone calls .
They put pins in their chairs , threw their clothes out of the window and locked them in the bathroom .
A BANK clerk was praised by police yesterday after she calmly locked a masked gunman inside the branch he was trying to rob .
He once locked two visiting American soldiers inside the cathedral one evening and promised to come to let them out in half an hour but forgot to come .
India-May locked Lumberjack inside the house .
He tossed the Colt Python onto the front seat then locked the keys inside the police car .
He then placed the ledger on top , and locked the articles into the sturdy cupboard beside the chimney breast .
I locked myself for two days and nights in my room without food or water or sleep .
` Are you saying you locked my mother in here ? " she demanded .
` She locked my mother in here years ago -- threatened her .
Maybe he did n't listen to the radio or read the dailies when he was locked away in his charming retreat .
Later she locked it away in her own empty suitcase , a place where she was sure even Giovanna would never find it .
And I 'm still waiting for you to explain why you locked me in here . "
You do n't want to lock your pictures away in a vault , so you make a vault of the room they 're in .
Mira falls asleep and dreams luridly about Celia whose father keeps her locked in a room in a castle , and will not feed her .
On the other hand , the little girl locked within her subconscious mind still linked thoughts of childbirth with her mother 's comment that it ` nearly killed me " .
We were just locked in , no food or anything .
` The murderer was locked in but how did he get out ?
